File_Description: Data package level readme. Contains data package summary; acknowledgements; and contact information.
Standard: N/A

File_Description: Data dictionary that defines columns headers across all comma-separated values (CSV) files contained in the data package.
Standard: ESS-DIVE Reporting Format for Comma-separated Values (CSV) File Structure (Velliquette et al. 2021)

File_Description: File-level metadata that lists and describes all of the files contained in the data package.
Standard: ESS-DIVE Reporting Format for Comma-separated Values (CSV) File Structure (Velliquette et al. 2021); ESS-DIVE Reporting Format for File-level Metadata (Velliquette et al. 2021)

File_Description: Step-by-step instructions used to complete the sampling in the field for data and sample names that have "CM" at the beginning.
Standard: N/A

File_Description: Step-by-step instructions used to complete the sampling in the field for data and sample names that have "SSS" at the beginning.
Standard: N/A

File_Description: Metadata for each set of samples collected at a given point in space and time. Each row generally refers to a set of many vials collected for different analysis and often includes three replicates per analysis collected together that are each named with the same sample name and each have a replicate identifier appended to the end to create a unique identifier (e.g. CM_005 provides information for the samples CM_005_ICR-1; CM_005_ICR-2; CM_005_ICR-3; which were individual vials collected in the field at the same time and location and can be treated as biological replicates). The metadata file provides accompanying information captured in the field (i.e. coordinates; date; turbidity; water color; weather; etc.).
Standard: ESS-DIVE Reporting Format for Comma-separated Values (CSV) File Structure (Velliquette et al. 2021)

File_Description: File that maps between sample names and registered International Generic Sample Numbers (IGSNs). Includes metadata required by Environmental System Science Data Infrastructure for a Virtual Ecosystem (ESS-DIVE) Reporting Format for Sample ID and Metadata (Damerow et al. 2020). Some fields are repeated from the field metadata. In compliance with the ESS-DIVE Location Metadata Reporting Format (Crystal-Ornelas et al. 2022) the Submission_Contact_Name; Submission_Contact_Email; Location_ID; Description; Latitude; and Longitude can all be found in the Dataset Metadata associated with this data package (and found on the ESS-DIVE landing page). The Location_ID; Latitude; and Longitude can also be found in v3_CM_SSS_IGSN-Mapping.csv as Locality; Latitude; and Longitude; respectively. There is no separate file associated with the ESS-DIVE Location Metadata Reporting Format.
Standard: ESS-DIVE Reporting Format for Comma-separated Values (CSV) File Structure (Velliquette et al. 2021); ESS-DIVE Reporting Format for Sample ID and Metadata (Damerow et al. 2020); ESS-DIVE Location Metadata Reporting Format (Crystal-Ornelas et al. 2022)

File_Description: Adenosine triphosphate (ATP) data from sediment samples. Methods information is embedded with methods codes that are defined in v4_CM_SSS_Methods_Codes.csv. The file follows the Environmental System Science Data Infrastructure for a Virtual Ecosystem (ESS-DIVE) Reporting Format for Soil; Sediment; and Water Chemistry data (Boye et al. 2022).
Standard: ESS-DIVE Reporting Format for Comma-separated Values (CSV) File Structure (Velliquette et al. 2021); ESS-DIVE Reporting Format for Soil; Sediment; and Water Chemistry (Boye et al. 2022)

File_Description: Total organic carbon and total nitrogen content data from sediment samples. Methods information is embedded with methods codes that are defined in v4_CM_SSS_Methods_Codes.csv. The file follows the Environmental System Science Data Infrastructure for a Virtual Ecosystem (ESS-DIVE) Reporting Format for Soil; Sediment; and Water Chemistry data (Boye et al. 2022).
Standard: ESS-DIVE Reporting Format for Comma-separated Values (CSV) File Structure (Velliquette et al. 2021); ESS-DIVE Reporting Format for Soil; Sediment; and Water Chemistry (Boye et al. 2022)

File_Description: Fourier-transform ion cyclotron resonance mass spectrometer (FTICR-MS) methods information embedded with method codes that are defined in v*_CM_SSS_Methods_Codes.csv. Data and instructions can be found in the FTICR folder. The file follows the Environmental System Science Data Infrastructure for a Virtual Ecosystem (ESS-DIVE) Reporting Format for Soil; Sediment; and Water Chemistry data (Boye et al. 2022).
Standard: ESS-DIVE Reporting Format for Comma-separated Values (CSV) File Structure (Velliquette et al. 2021); ESS-DIVE Reporting Format for Soil; Sediment; and Water Chemistry (Boye et al. 2022)

File_Description: Gravimetric moisture from sediment samples. Methods information is embedded with methods codes that are defined in v4_CM_SSS_Methods_Codes.csv. The file follows the Environmental System Science Data Infrastructure for a Virtual Ecosystem (ESS-DIVE) Reporting Format for Soil; Sediment; and Water Chemistry data (Boye et al. 2022).
Standard: ESS-DIVE Reporting Format for Comma-separated Values (CSV) File Structure (Velliquette et al. 2021); ESS-DIVE Reporting Format for Soil; Sediment; and Water Chemistry (Boye et al. 2022)

File_Description: Dissolved organic carbon (DOC; reported as non-purgeable organic carbon; NPOC) and total nitrogen (TN) extracted from less than 2 millimeter sediment samples using MilliQ water. Methods information is embedded with methods codes that are defined in v*_CM_SSS_Methods_Codes.csv. The file follows the Environmental System Science Data Infrastructure for a Virtual Ecosystem (ESS-DIVE) Reporting Format for Soil; Sediment; and Water Chemistry data (Boye et al. 2022).
Standard: ESS-DIVE Reporting Format for Comma-separated Values (CSV) File Structure (Velliquette et al. 2021); ESS-DIVE Reporting Format for Soil; Sediment; and Water Chemistry (Boye et al. 2022)

File_Description: Specific surface area data from sediment samples. This analysis was run on a subset of samples; more samples may be added in the future. Methods information is embedded with methods codes that are defined in v4_CM_SSS_Methods_Codes.csv. The file follows the Environmental System Science Data Infrastructure for a Virtual Ecosystem (ESS-DIVE) Reporting Format for Soil; Sediment; and Water Chemistry data (Boye et al. 2022).
Standard: ESS-DIVE Reporting Format for Comma-separated Values (CSV) File Structure (Velliquette et al. 2021); ESS-DIVE Reporting Format for Soil; Sediment; and Water Chemistry (Boye et al. 2022)

File_Description: X-ray diffraction (XRD) data from sediment samples. Methods information is embedded with methods codes that are defined in v4_CM_SSS_Methods_Codes.csv. The file follows the Environmental System Science Data Infrastructure for a Virtual Ecosystem (ESS-DIVE) Reporting Format for Soil; Sediment; and Water Chemistry data (Boye et al. 2022).
Standard: ESS-DIVE Reporting Format for Comma-separated Values (CSV) File Structure (Velliquette et al. 2021); ESS-DIVE Reporting Format for Soil; Sediment; and Water Chemistry (Boye et al. 2022)

File_Description: Fourier-transform ion cyclotron resonance mass spectrometer (FTICR-MS) methods information embedded with method codes that are defined in v*_CM_SSS_Methods_Codes.csv. Data and instructions can be found in the FTICR folder. The file follows the Environmental System Science Data Infrastructure for a Virtual Ecosystem (ESS-DIVE) Reporting Format for Soil; Sediment; and Water Chemistry data (Boye et al. 2022).
Standard: ESS-DIVE Reporting Format for Comma-separated Values (CSV) File Structure (Velliquette et al. 2021); ESS-DIVE Reporting Format for Soil; Sediment; and Water Chemistry (Boye et al. 2022)

File_Description: Ion data from water samples. Methods information is embedded with methods codes that are defined in v4_CM_SSS_Methods_Codes.csv. The file follows the Environmental System Science Data Infrastructure for a Virtual Ecosystem (ESS-DIVE) Reporting Format for Soil; Sediment; and Water Chemistry data (Boye et al. 2022).
Standard: ESS-DIVE Reporting Format for Comma-separated Values (CSV) File Structure (Velliquette et al. 2021); ESS-DIVE Reporting Format for Soil; Sediment; and Water Chemistry (Boye et al. 2022)

File_Description: Mean respiration rates normalized to sediment volume in the incubation vials. Methods information is embedded with methods codes that are defined in v4_CM_SSS_Methods_Codes.csv. The file follows the Environmental System Science Data Infrastructure for a Virtual Ecosystem (ESS-DIVE) Reporting Format for Soil; Sediment; and Water Chemistry data (Boye et al. 2022). The calculation used to produce some of these data (theoretical respiration rates) includes assumptions that the project team has decided are appropriate; but the user should decide if using this data is appropriate for their analysis. See methods deviation codes for more detail.
Standard: ESS-DIVE Reporting Format for Comma-separated Values (CSV) File Structure (Velliquette et al. 2021); ESS-DIVE Reporting Format for Soil; Sediment; and Water Chemistry (Boye et al. 2022)

File_Description: Iron (II) data from sediment samples. Methods information is embedded with methods codes that are defined in "v*_CM_SSS_Methods_Codes.csv". The file follows the Environmental System Science Data Infrastructure for a Virtual Ecosystem (ESS-DIVE) Reporting Format for Soil; Sediment; and Water Chemistry data (Boye et al. 2022). Samples that were incubated with both 10 milliliters of sediment and 2.5 milliliters of sediment have three additional replicates (-4; -5; -6 in addition to -1; -2; -3).
Standard: ESS-DIVE Reporting Format for Comma-separated Values (CSV) File Structure (Velliquette et al. 2021); ESS-DIVE Reporting Format for Soil; Sediment; and Water Chemistry (Boye et al. 2022)

File_Description: Sediment grain size distribution (percent fine sane; percent medium sand; percent coarse sand; percent total sand; percent clay; percent silt) measured from the less than 2 millimeter fraction of sediment. Methods information is embedded with methods codes that are defined in v4_CM_SSS_Methods_Codes.csv. The file follows the Environmental System Science Data Infrastructure for a Virtual Ecosystem (ESS-DIVE) Reporting Format for Soil; Sediment; and Water Chemistry data (Boye et al. 2022).
Standard: ESS-DIVE Reporting Format for Comma-separated Values (CSV) File Structure (Velliquette et al. 2021); ESS-DIVE Reporting Format for Soil; Sediment; and Water Chemistry (Boye et al. 2022)

File_Description: Respiration rates calculated from time series dissolved oxygen data measured from laboratory incubations of sediment. This data is used by the machine learning model. Methods information is embedded with methods codes that are defined in v4_CM_SSS_Methods_Codes.csv. The file follows the Environmental System Science Data Infrastructure for a Virtual Ecosystem (ESS-DIVE) Reporting Format for Soil; Sediment; and Water Chemistry data (Boye et al. 2022). Samples where data from the 2.5 milliliters of sediment was used have reps 4; 5; and 6 instead of 1; 2; and 3. Reps 1; 2; and 3 were used for the 10 milliliter incubation and that data was not used. The calculation used to produce some of these data (theoretical respiration rates) includes assumptions that the project team has decided are appropriate; but the user should decide if using this data is appropriate for their analysis. See methods deviation codes for more detail.
Standard: ESS-DIVE Reporting Format for Comma-separated Values (CSV) File Structure (Velliquette et al. 2021); ESS-DIVE Reporting Format for Soil; Sediment; and Water Chemistry (Boye et al. 2022)

File_Description: Dissolved organic carbon (DOC; reported as non-purgeable organic carbon; NPOC) and total nitrogen (TN) from water samples. Methods information is embedded with methods codes that are defined in v4_CM_SSS_Methods_Codes.csv. The file follows the Environmental System Science Data Infrastructure for a Virtual Ecosystem (ESS-DIVE) Reporting Format for Soil; Sediment; and Water Chemistry data (Boye et al. 2022).
Standard: ESS-DIVE Reporting Format for Comma-separated Values (CSV) File Structure (Velliquette et al. 2021); ESS-DIVE Reporting Format for Soil; Sediment; and Water Chemistry (Boye et al. 2022)

File_Description: Mean iron (II); mean respiration; mean normalized respiration; specific surface area; grain size; mean adenosine triphosphate (ATP); X-Ray diffraction (XRD); mean gravimetric moisture; and percent carbon and nitrogen (CN) from sediment samples. Methods information is embedded with methods codes that are defined in v4_CM_SSS_Methods_Codes.csv. The file follows the Environmental System Science Data Infrastructure for a Virtual Ecosystem (ESS-DIVE) Reporting Format for Soil; Sediment; and Water Chemistry data (Boye et al. 2022). For each sampling event (e.g. CM_005_Sediment); the iron (Fe) values of all biological and analytical replicates of 10 milliliter incubations ONLY (i.e. replicates -1; -2; and -3) are averaged. The other data types have values of all biological replicates averaged per sampling event. The grain size data; XRD data; and CN data is not averaged because there is only one rep per sampling event; therefore CM_005_Sediment is the same as CM_005_GRN; CM_005_XRD; and CM_005_SSA. The "Mean_Missing_Reps" column indicates if a mean does not include all replicates using a TRUE/FALSE flag where TRUE indicates one or more replicates are missing from the mean. This file was previously called "CM_SSS_Sediment_Normalized_Respiration_Rates_Summary.csv". Specific surface area was run on a subset of sampling events (i.e. Parent ID). Specific surface area data from additional sampling events (i.e. Parent_IDs) may be added in the future.
Standard: ESS-DIVE Reporting Format for Comma-separated Values (CSV) File Structure (Velliquette et al. 2021); ESS-DIVE Reporting Format for Soil; Sediment; and Water Chemistry (Boye et al. 2022)

File_Description: Wet sediment mass; dry sediment mass; water mass; and wet sediment volume in incubation and sediment vials. The data from samples with "INC" in the sample name were used to normalize the respiration data. The data from samples with "SED" in the sample name were used to normalize the sediment NPOC/TN data. Methods information is embedded with methods codes that are defined in v4_CM_SSS_Methods_Codes.csv. The file follows the Environmental System Science Data Infrastructure for a Virtual Ecosystem (ESS-DIVE) Reporting Format for Soil; Sediment; and Water Chemistry data (Boye et al. 2022). Samples that were incubated with both 10 milliliters of sediment and 2.5 milliliters of sediment have three additional replicates (-4; -5; -6 in addition to -1; -2; -3).
Standard: ESS-DIVE Reporting Format for Comma-separated Values (CSV) File Structure (Velliquette et al. 2021); ESS-DIVE Reporting Format for Soil; Sediment; and Water Chemistry (Boye et al. 2022)

File_Description: Mean dissolved organic carbon (DOC; measured as non-purgeable organic carbon; NPOC); mean total nitrogen; and mean ion data from water samples. For each sampling event (e.g. CM_005_OCN) the values of each of the three biological replicates (e.g. CM_005_OCN-1; CM_005_OCN-2; CM_005_OCN-3) are averaged. Any replicate values that were an outlier (using distance-based outlier detection) or above/below the limit of detection are not included in the mean. The "Mean_Missing_Reps" column indicates if a mean does not include all three replicates using a TRUE/FALSE flag where TRUE indicates one or more replicates are missing from the mean. Methods information is embedded with methods codes that are defined in v4_CM_SSS_Methods_Codes.csv. The file follows the Environmental System Science Data Infrastructure for a Virtual Ecosystem (ESS-DIVE) Reporting Format for Soil; Sediment; and Water Chemistry data (Boye et al. 2022). This file was previously called "CM_SSS_Water_NPOC_TN_Summary.csv".
Standard: ESS-DIVE Reporting Format for Comma-separated Values (CSV) File Structure (Velliquette et al. 2021); ESS-DIVE Reporting Format for Soil; Sediment; and Water Chemistry (Boye et al. 2022)

File_Description: Definitions of methods codes used in sample data files. The file follows the Environmental System Science Data Infrastructure for a Virtual Ecosystem (ESS-DIVE) Reporting Format for Soil; Sediment; and Water Chemistry data (Boye et al. 2022).
Standard: ESS-DIVE Reporting Format for Comma-separated Values (CSV) File Structure (Velliquette et al. 2021); ESS-DIVE Reporting Format for Soil; Sediment; and Water Chemistry (Boye et al. 2022)

File_Description: Processed FTICR-MS data containing molecular information describing each mass value for both sediment and water samples in the files ending in  "CoreMS_Processed_ICR_Data.csv". Use the "Calibrated_Mass" column to merge molecular properties with the data files. This data is processed from .xml files.
Standard: ESS-DIVE Reporting Format for Comma-separated Values (CSV) File Structure (Velliquette et al. 2021)

File_Description: Combined CoreMS calibration outputs (.cal files) across all sediment samples.  This data is processed from .xml files.
Standard: ESS-DIVE Reporting Format for Comma-separated Values (CSV) File Structure (Velliquette et al. 2021)

File_Description: Processed FTICR-MS mass-by-sample data from sediment extract samples. The first column contains calibrated masses. The following columns are samples. Each row is a peak intensity with values higher than zero indicating the peak is present in that sample. Use the "Calibrated_Mass" column to merge data with the mol files.  This data is processed from .xml files.
Standard: ESS-DIVE Reporting Format for Comma-separated Values (CSV) File Structure (Velliquette et al. 2021)

File_Description: Combined CoreMS calibration outputs (.cal files) across all water samples.  This data is processed from .xml files.
Standard: ESS-DIVE Reporting Format for Comma-separated Values (CSV) File Structure (Velliquette et al. 2021)

File_Description: Processed FTICR-MS mass-by-sample data from water samples. The first column contains calibrated masses. The following columns are samples. Each row is a peak intensity with values higher than zero indicating the peak is present in that sample. Use the "Calibrated_Mass" column to merge data with the mol files.  This data is processed from .xml files.
Standard: ESS-DIVE Reporting Format for Comma-separated Values (CSV) File Structure (Velliquette et al. 2021)

File_Description: R markdown that combines CoreMS outputs (.corems.csv files) contained in a specified directory. Additionally, this markdown will run ftmsRanalysis to calculate additional molecular information and Song et al lambda calculation.  See "Instructions_for_Processing_FTICR_Data_using_CoreMS.pdf" for more details.
Standard: N/A

File_Description: Python script used to run the CoreMS workflow and generates CoreMS outputs.  See "Instructions_for_Processing_FTICR_Data_using_CoreMS.pdf" for more details.
Standard: N/A

File_Description: R script that  formats files from CoreMS outputs into ESS-DIVE CSV reporting format compliant files. This script is provided for traceability.
Standard: N/A

File_Description: R script for the lambda calculation from Song et al 2020 (https://doi.org/10.3389/fmicb.2020.531756). Modified from https://github.com/hyunseobsong/lambda.
Standard: N/A

File_Description: Instructions for processing FTICR-MS data using our CoreMS pipeline.
Standard: N/A

File_Description: CoreMS mass calibration file. The first asterisk * indicates the sample name; "SED" indicates it was a sediment extract sample. "SED" is followed by a hyphen and the replicate indicator (1; 2; or 3); followed by  the ion accumulation time (IAT). The "p" in the IAT indicates the decimal point (i.e. p01 indicates an IAT of 0.1 and 1p2 indicates an IAT of 1.2). Each sample had three replicates. FTICR methods information can be found in  CM_SSS_Sediment_FTICR_Methods.csv.csv and the file ending in "Methods_Codes.csv". See the FTICR_Instructions folder and readme for more details.
Standard: N/A

File_Description: CoreMS output FTICR-MS files.  This data is processed from .xml files. The first asterisk * indicates the sample name; "SED" indicates it was a sediment extract sample. "SED" is followed by a hyphen and the replicate indicator (1; 2; or 3); followed by  the ion accumulation time (IAT). The "p" in the IAT indicates the decimal point (i.e. p01 indicates an IAT of 0.1 and 1p2 indicates an IAT of 1.2). Each sample had three replicates. FTICR methods information can be found in  CM_SSS_Sediment_FTICR_Methods.csv.csv and the file ending in "Methods_Codes.csv". See the FTICR_Instructions folder and readme for more details.
Standard: ESS-DIVE Reporting Format for Comma-separated Values (CSV) File Structure (Velliquette et al. 2021)

File_Description: The R code used to calculate respiration rates from the time series dissolved oxygen data for sample names that have "CM" at the beginning.
Standard: N/A

File_Description: Brief description of the R code and input file used to calculate respiration rates from time series dissolved oxygen data.
Standard: N/A

File_Description: Time series dissolved oxygen data used to calculate respiration rates for samples starting with SSS. The detection limit for the Fibox 3 is 0.015 milligrams per liter and the precision is 0.04 milligrams per liter.
Standard: ESS-DIVE Reporting Format for Comma-separated Values (CSV) File Structure (Velliquette et al. 2021)

File_Description: The R code used to calculate respiration rates from the time series dissolved oxygen data for sample names that have "SSS" at the beginning.
Standard: N/A

File_Description: Time series dissolved oxygen data used to calculate respiration rates for data and sample names that have "CM" at the beginning. The detection limit for the Fibox 3 is 0.015 milligrams per liter and the precision is 0.04 milligrams per liter.
Standard: ESS-DIVE Reporting Format for Comma-separated Values (CSV) File Structure (Velliquette et al. 2021)

File_Description: Plots of time series dissolved oxygen data and incubation time.
Standard: N/A

File_Description: Description of methods associated with installation/deployment of sensors. Required by Environmental System Science Data Infrastructure for a Virtual Ecosystem (ESS-DIVE) Reporting Format for Hydrologic Monitoring (Goldman et al. 2021).
Standard: ESS-DIVE Reporting Format for Hydrologic Monitoring Data and Metadata (Goldman et al. 2021); ESS-DIVE Reporting Format for Comma-separated Values (CSV) File Structure (Velliquette et al. 2021)

File_Description: Summary statistics (e.g. mean; standard deviation) for miniDOT data (dissolved oxygen and temperature). This data is used by the machine learning model. This file was previously called "CM_SSS_miniDOT_DO_Temp_Summary.csv".
Standard: ESS-DIVE Reporting Format for Hydrologic Monitoring Data and Metadata (Goldman et al. 2021); ESS-DIVE Reporting Format for Comma-separated Values (CSV) File Structure (Velliquette et al. 2021)

File_Description: Time series data (temperature; dissolved oxygen) collected using miniDOT sensor for each sampling event. The asterisk * refers to the version number and Parent_ID (e.g. CM_005).
Standard: ESS-DIVE Reporting Format for Hydrologic Monitoring Data and Metadata (Goldman et al. 2021); ESS-DIVE Reporting Format for Comma-separated Values (CSV) File Structure (Velliquette et al. 2021)

File_Description: Time series plots of data from miniDOT sensor for each sampling event.
Standard: N/A

File_Description: Raw FTICR-MS unprocessed instrument files. The asterisk * indicates the sample name; followed by a hyphen and the replicate indicator (1; 2; or 3); followed by the ion accumulation time (IAT). A "p" in the IAT indicates "point" (e.g., 2p5 = 2.5; p01 = 0.01). Each sample has three replicates. During solid phase extraction (SPE), FTICR-MS samples were diluted to achieve a  standard NPOC concentration of 1.5 milligrams carbon per liter. For theses sediment samples (labeled with “SED” in the sample name), the sediment NPOC values were used for this calculation (labeled with “SED” in the sample name). For example, CM_001_SED-1 NPOC values were used to determine the dilution for CM_001_SED-1. FTICR methods information can be found in CM_SSS_Sediment_FTICR_Methods.csv, CM_SSS_Water_FTICR_Methods.csv. and v*_CM_SSS_Methods_Codes.csv. See the critical details section in the readme for more information about these data.
Standard: N/A

File_Description: Field photos to show the environmental context of each SSS site. The first asterisk refers to the site ID and date. The second asterisk is an indicator to differentiate photos taken at the same site and date; and the file extension (.jpg; .png; .jpeg). Samplers took photos looking upstream; downstream; and across stream at most sites.
Standard: N/A

File_Description: Field videos to show the environmental context of each SSS site. The first asterisk refers to the site ID and date. The second asterisk is an indicator to differentiate videos taken at the same site and date; and the file extension (.mp4; .mov). Each video should start by looking directly upstream with riparian vegetation in view and rotate towards the river downstream until looking directly down the shoreline with riparian vegetation in view.
Standard: N/A

File_Description: Field photos to show the environmental context of each CM site. The asterisk refers to the Parent_ID followed by an indicator of what the photo is of (i.e. across [across stream]; collection; data; down [downstream]; exposed [exposed shoreline sediment]; up [upstream]); and the file extension (.jpg; .png; .jpeg).
Standard: N/A
